description:
Highlights of the NVIDIA 570 graphics driver series include VRR (variable refresh rate) support on multi-monitor setups, along with a new conceal_vrr_caps kernel module parameter to enable usage of features on some displays, such as ULMB (Ultra Low Motion Blur), which are incompatible with VRR.

The post NVIDIA 570 Linux Graphics Driver Released with New Features and Improvements appeared first on Linux Today.
title: NVIDIA 570 Linux Graphics Driver Released with New Features and Improvements

description:
LibreOffice 25.2.1 is here three weeks after the LibreOffice 25.2 release to address various bugs, crashes, and other annoyances reported by users in an attempt to improve the overall stability and reliability of this popular open-source, free, and cross-platform office suite.

The post LibreOffice 25.2.1 Office Suite Is Now Available for Download with 77 Bug Fixes appeared first on Linux Today.
title: LibreOffice 25.2.1 Office Suite Is Now Available for Download with 77 Bug Fixes

description:
The Open Infrastructure Foundation is out with the release of StarlingX 10.0, a significant update to the open-source distributed cloud platform designed for IoT, 5G, O-RAN and edge computing applications.

The post Starlingx Bridges IPV4-IPV6 Gap With Dual-Stack Networking Support appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Starlingx Bridges IPV4-IPV6 Gap With Dual-Stack Networking Support

description:
Mozilla introduced a Terms of Use and updated its Privacy Notice, ensuring that Firefox remains open source while offering more transparency regarding data collection and use.

The post Mozilla Introduces Firefox’s First-Ever Terms of Use appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Mozilla Introduces Firefox’s First-Ever Terms of Use

description:
A drum machine is an electronic musical instrument that creates percussion sounds, drum beats, and patterns. We feature our recommended free and open source drum machines.

The post 7 Best Free and Open Source Drum Machines appeared first on Linux Today.
title: 7 Best Free and Open Source Drum Machines

description:
In this guide, we’ll explain everything you need to know about port numbers, including commonly used port numbers and their uses.

The post Understanding Common Port Numbers: A Beginner’s Guide to Networking appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Understanding Common Port Numbers: A Beginner’s Guide to Networking

description:
Linux is a powerful and efficient operating system, but high RAM and CPU usage can degrade performance, slow down applications, and even cause system crashes when you’re running a server, workstation, or embedded system, and optimizing resource usage is essential for smooth operation. In this guide, we’ll explore practical methods to reduce RAM and CPU […]

The post How to Reduce RAM & CPU Usage on Linux appeared first on Linux Today.
title: How to Reduce RAM & CPU Usage on Linux

description:
FreeDOS is a free and open-source DOS-compatible operating system that allows you to run legacy DOS software and games on modern hardware. While Linux is a powerful and versatile operating system, there are times when you might need to run DOS-based applications for compatibility or nostalgia. In this guide, I’ll walk you through the steps […]

The post How to Set Up FreeDOS on Linux Using Qemu appeared first on Linux Today.
title: How to Set Up FreeDOS on Linux Using Qemu

description:
TLDR pages are a collection of community-maintained cheatsheets for internal and external commands on Linux that can be accessed by anyone.

The post How to Use TLDR Pages on Linux (and Install It’s CLI Tool) appeared first on Linux Today.
title: How to Use TLDR Pages on Linux (and Install It’s CLI Tool)

description:
Immich 1.127, a self-hosted photo and video backup solution, enhances the memories feature, adds manual face tagging, and introduces star rating search.

The post Immich 1.127 Introduces Face Tagging & Memory Enhancements appeared first on Linux Today.
title: Immich 1.127 Introduces Face Tagging & Memory Enhancements
